welcome.title: TW Values
welcome.content: TW Values is a political quiz that helps users to explore their political ideology by answering a series of questions.
welcome.privacy: Privacy Notice: The quiz is open source and will not collect or store any personal information.

introduction.title: What is TW Values ?
introduction.description: TW Values is a political quiz. Users are going to be asked {{count}} questions to identify their ideologies and political party matches. There are seven categories and each has two opposing values.

q0000.description: It is necessary for the government to intervene in the economy to protect consumers.

q0001.description: Taxes should be increased on the rich to provide for the poor.

q0002.description: Basic utilities like roads and electricity should be publicly owned.

q0003.description: Quality education is a right of all people.

q0004.description: The government should increase the rate of the House Hoarding Tax.

q0100.description: For the sake of economic growth, sacrifice of labor rights is acceptable. Whoever invented unpaid leave should win a Nobel Prize.

q0101.description: Inheritance is a legitimate form of wealth.

q0102.description: Government intervention is a threat to the economy.

q0103.description: Those with a greater ability to pay should receive better healthcare.

q0104.description: It is better to maintain a balanced budget than to ensure welfare for all citizens.

q0200.description: Governments should be as concerned about foreigners as they are about their own citizens.

q0201.description: Governments should be accountable to the international community.

q0202.description: The government should restart negotiation on Cross-Strait Service Trade Agreement with P.R.C..

q0203.description: We should be open to immigration.

q0300.description: International aid is a waste of money.

q0301.description: Regardless of political opinions, it is important to side with your country.

q0302.description: Tariffs on international trade are important to encourage local production.

q0303.description: The United Nations should be abolished.

q0401.description: The very existence of the state is a threat to our liberty.

q0402.description: Protest marches should not require prior application.

q0403.description: It is important that the government follows the majority opinion, even if it is wrong.

q0404.description: Political leaders should be able to be satirized or vilified in artistic works.

q0405.description: Drug use should be legalized or decriminalized.

q0500.description: The minimum age for participation in elections should NOT be changed from 20 to 18.

q0501.description: Government surveillance is necessary in the modern world.

q0502.description: The sacrifice of some civil liberties is necessary to protect us from acts of terrorism.

q0503.description: The stronger the leadership, the better.

q0504.description: Even when protesting an authoritarian government, violence is not acceptable.

q0505.description: It is important to maintain law and order.

q0506.description: Our country should be led by the elite, and the people at the bottom do not deserve citizenship.

q0600.description: We should believe in modern medicine and despise traditional medicine.

q0601.description: Churches should be taxed the same way other institutions are taxed.

q0604.description: Traditions are of no value on their own.

q0605.description: Women are also obliged to serve in the military to defend our country.

q0700.description: Society was better many years ago than it is now.

q0703.description: Abortion should be prohibited in most or all cases.

q0705.description:
- Young and beautiful girls, suitable for being counter staff.
- It is scary for women to go out on the street without makeup.
- Too many unmarried women are a national security concern.

q0800.description: Climate change is currently one of the greatest threats to our way of life.

q0801.description: It is acceptable to increase the cost of living in pursuit of environmental protection.

q0802.description: The extinction of species due to human actions is unacceptable.

q0803.description: The development of renewable energy is of paramount importance.

q0900.description: It is acceptable to have environmental pollution in pursuit of economic growth.

q0901.description: The use of cheap fossil fuels is necessary.

q0902.description: There should not be any quotas on fishing.

q1000.description: Our nation is already a sovereign and independent country.

q1001.description: A constitution for Republic of Taiwan should be enacted immediately.

q1002.description: Military spending is essential to protect our country.

q1003.description: Participate in international events as Chinese Taipei is unacceptable.

q1100.description: Taiwan is a province of People's Republic of China (P.R.C.).

q1101.description: Political negotiations with P.R.C. should be carried out immediately to achieve national unification.

q1102.description: The government should sign cross-strait peace agreement with P.R.C. as soon as possible.

q1103.description: Republic of China (R.O.C.) is the sole legitimate government of China.

q1200.description: The government should stand with U.S. against P.R.C.

q1201.description: A referendum should be held immediately to join the U.S. as the 51st state of them.

q1202.description: The U.S. military will definitely help Taiwan against China when a war breaks out in the Taiwan Strait.

q1301.description: The goverment should claim that South China Sea are both China's territory.

api_error.description: Sorry, your result is incompatible with current version. Please do the quiz again.

equality.name: Equality
equality.description: Those with higher Equality scores believe the economy should distribute value evenly among the populace. They tend to support progressive tax codes, social programs, and even socialism.

efficiency.name: Efficiency
efficiency.description: Those with higher Efficiency scores believe the economy should be focused on rapid growth. They tend to support lower taxes, privatization, deregulation, and even laissez-faire capitalism.

globe.name: Globe
globe.description: Those with higher Globe scores believe in a peaceful foreign policy, emphasizing diplomacy, cooperation, integration and even a world government. They are often globalists.

nation.name: Nation
nation.description: Those with higher Nation scores believe in an aggressive foreign policy, valuing the military, strength, sovereignty, and even territorial expansion. They are often nationalists.

liberty.name: Liberty
liberty.description: Those with higher Liberty scores believe in strong civil liberties. They tend to support democracy and oppose state intervention in personal lives.

authority.name: Authority
authority.description: Those with higher Authority scores believe in strong state power. They tend to support government surveillance and even autocracy.

ecology.name: Ecology
ecology.description: Those with higher Ecology scores believe that climate change has become the greatest threat to humanity, including global warming, expansion of deserts, rising of sea level and wildfire. They tend to support environmental protection and development of renewable energy.

production.name: Production
production.description: Those with higher Production scores believe that economic growth is more important, even though it causes environmental pollution. They tend to use cheap fossil fuels and think that development of renewable energy is a waste of money.

progress.name: Progress
progress.description: Those with higher Progress scores believe in social change and rationality. They are usually secular or atheist, and support science or modern technologies.

tradition.name: Tradition
tradition.description: Those with higher Tradition scores believe in traditional values and strict adherence to a moral code. They are sometimes religious and support status quo.

independence.name: Independence
independence.description: Those with higher Independence scores believe that People's Republic of China does not own sovereignty over Taiwan. They are usually Taiwanese Nationalists and tend to support liberty and democracy.

unification.name: Unification
unification.description: Those with higher Unification scores believe that only one government should be formed between Chinese Mainland and Taiwan. They are usually Chinese Nationalists and tend to support the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation.

pro_american.name: Pro-American
pro_american.description: Those with higher Pro-American scores believe that Taiwan's semiconductor industry, technologies and military aids rely on United States. They tend to join U.S. alliance and support democracy.

pro_chinese.name: Pro-Chinese
pro_chinese.description: Those with higher Pro-Chinese scores believe that Taiwan's export reliance on Chinese market is neccesary and unable to withstand trade sanctions. They tend to keep peaceful relationship with China.

roc_unification.name: R.O.C. Unification
roc_unification.description: Republic of China retake Mainland China and be the sole legitimate government of China.

roc_independence.name: R.O.C. Independence
roc_independence.description: Republic of China renounce China's territory and sovereignty and become two completely independent states with the People's Republic of China.

tw_independence.name: Taiwan Independence
tw_independence.description: Taiwan Independence which advocates the formal declaration of an independent and sovereign Taiwanese state to replace Republic of China.

prc_unification.name: P.R.C. Unification
prc_unification.description: Taiwan becomes a province of People's Republic of China.

death_penalty_abolitionists.name: Death Penalty Abolitionists
death_penalty_abolitionists.description: Abolish the death penalty and replace it with life imprisonment or other punishments.

homophobia.name: Homophobia
homophobia.description: Homophobia encompasses a range of negative attitudes and feelings toward homosexuality or people who identify or are perceived as being lesbian, gay or bisexual. It has been defined as contempt, prejudice, aversion, hatred or antipathy, may be based on irrational fear and may sometimes be related to religious beliefs.

male_chauvinism.name: Male Chauvinism
male_chauvinism.description: Male prejudice against women; the belief that men are superior in terms of ability, intelligence, etc.

feminism.name: Feminism
feminism.description: Feminism is a range of socio-political movements and ideologies that aim to define and establish the political, economic, personal, and social equality of the sexes.

feminism_buffet.name: Feminism Buffet
feminism_buffet.description: Women who reap the benefits of equality between men and women in the name of women's rights are unwilling to give up the dividends of patriarchy.

political_apathy.name: Political Apathy
political_apathy.description: In political science, political apathy is a lack of interest or apathy towards politics.
